'''Poochyena''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ポチエナ''' ''Pochiena'') is a {{type|Dark}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Mightyena}} starting at [[level]] 18.

==Biology==
Poochyena is a quadruped Pokémon similar in appearance to hyenas and canines. Its body is primarily gray with a black face and throat, paws, and belly. Its eyes are red with yellow sclerae, and it has a red nose. Its lower jaw has two pointed teeth sticking out. The fur at the base of its tail is rumpled and shaggy. Poochyena has gray paw pads on its three-toed paws.

Poochyena has a very keen sense of smell, allowing it to find and chase its prey with ease. It takes a bite at anything that moves, and makes the hair on its tail bristle out to try to intimidate its foes. Known for its tenacious nature, it chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. If its prey strikes back, it may turn tail. It is omnivorous and will eat anything. This Pokémon lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grasslands}} and forests.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Team Flare Poochyena.png|thumb|left|250px|Poochyena in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
A pack of Poochyena appeared in ''[[AG001|Get the Show on the Road]]''. They attacked [[Professor Birch]] when he got separated from {{Ash}}, similarly to what happened in {{game|Ruby and Sapphire|s}}.

A Poochyena appeared in ''[[AG011|A Bite to Remember]]'', where [[Max]] befriended it and helped it to evolve.

A Poochyena appeared in ''[[SS005|The Blue Badge of Courage]]'', under the ownership of one of the [[Gym Badge thieves]].

A wild Poochyena appeared in ''[[AG071|A Six Pack Attack!]]'' to assist Professor Birch in finding {{an|Professor Oak}}, {{an|May}}, and [[Max]].

A Poochyena appeared in ''[[XY107|An Explosive Operation!]]'', under the ownership of a {{tc|Team Flare Grunt}}.

====Minor appearances====
A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Poochyena appeared in ''[[AG013|All Things Bright and Beautifly!]]'', where it was competing in the {{ci|Rustboro}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

A Poochyena was seen inside the [[Slateport City]] [[Pokémon Center]] in ''[[AG033|Now That's Flower Power!]]''.

A Poochyena appeared in ''[[AG035|Win, Lose, or Drew!]]'', under the ownership of a Coordinator competing in the {{ci|Slateport}} Contest.

Two Poochyena appeared in ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]''. One was seen playing with its owner in the opening sequence, while the other one was a [[wild Pokémon]] that lived in [[Forina]].

A Poochyena appeared in ''[[AG061|Disaster of Disguise]]'' and ''[[AG062|Disguise Da Limit]]''. It first appeared under the ownership of a young girl. Later, during [[Mrs. Grimm]]'s flashback, it was revealed that she owned one as a child.

A Poochyena appeared in ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]'', under the ownership of a Trainer.

A Poochyena appeared in ''[[AG121|Hi Ho Silver Wind!]]'', under the ownership of a Coordinator competing in the [[Hoenn Grand Festival]].

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Poochyena appeared in ''[[AG159|Off the Unbeaten Path]]'', where it was participating in the [[Pokémon Orienteering]].

A Poochyena briefly appeared in ''[[DP182|An Old Family Blend!]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Trainer]] competing in the [[Lily of the Valley Conference]].

A Poochyena appeared in ''[[XY002|Lumiose City Pursuit!]]''.

Two Poochyena appeared in ''[[XY008|Grooming Furfrou!]]''.

A Trainer's Poochyena appeared in ''[[XY041|Foggy Pokémon Orienteering!]]'' and ''[[XY042|Battling Into the Hall of Fame!]]''.

A Trainer's Poochyena appeared in ''[[XY068|Garchomp's Mega Bond!]]''.

A Trainer's Poochyena appeared in ''[[XY091|A Performance Pop Quiz!]]''.

A Trainer's Poochyena appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Nana Poochyena.png|thumb|130px|Poochyena in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Nana}}
A Poochyena named Nana is first seen in {{adv|Ruby}}'s possession, one of the three Pokémon given to him from his father, [[Norman]], when he was very young. Even five years before ''[[PS181|Creeping Past Cacnea]]'', Nana was shown to be a formidable battler, injuring a {{TP|Zinnia|Salamence}} teaming up with [[Kiki]] and [[Rara]]. While she still hadn't evolved, Ruby saw a few wild {{p|Mightyena}} that attacked {{prof|Birch}} and envied how splendid their fur looked. A few chapters down the line, Ruby would obtain his own Mightyena in [[Dewford Town]] when he met up with {{Steven}}, and Nana evolved together with Kiki, who touched the champion's [[Moon Stone]]. This new evolved form saw a furthering of Nana's abilities, allowing her to perfect her {{m|Hyper Beam}} attack.

===In the Pokémon Chamo-Chamo ☆ Pretty ♪ manga===
{{main|Kanata's Poochyena}}
[[Kanata (CCP)|Kanata]] has a Poochyena in the [[Pokémon Chamo-Chamo ☆ Pretty ♪]] manga.

==Trivia==
* Poochyena has the lowest base {{stat|HP}}, {{stat|Special Attack}} stat, and base stat total of all {{type|Dark}} Pokémon.

===Origin===
{{Bulbanews|On the Origin of Species: Poochyena and Mightyena}}
It shares some similarities with both wolves and hyenas. However, its small size, typically tenacious nature, and affinity for biting calls to mind {{wp|Tasmanian devil|Tasmanian devils}}.

====Name origin====
Poochyena is a combination of ''pooch'' (slang for ''dog'') and ''{{wp|hyena}}''.

Pochiena may be a combination of ''Pochi'' (a popular name for dogs in Japan) and ''{{wp|hyena}}''.
